CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Material Name" entities:

1. Semiconductor
2. Electric field
3. Current density
4. Voltage

Explanation:

1. Semiconductor: The paragraph specifically mentions "recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field" which implies that the material being referred to is a semiconductor.
2. Electric field: The paragraph mentions "high internal electric field" which refers to the electric field within the semiconductor material.
3. Current density: The paragraph mentions "current density becomes saturated" which refers to the current density within the semiconductor material.
4. Voltage: The paragraph mentions "reversed voltage" which refers to the voltage applied across the semiconductor material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the given paragraph:

1. Semiconductor

Explanation: The paragraph specifically mentions "recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field" which implies that the material being referred to is a semiconductor.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Semiconductor |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. Reverse voltage - This is a property of the device being discussed, as it refers to the voltage applied across the device in the opposite direction to the conventional flow of current.
2. Internal electric field - This is another property of the device, as it refers to the electric field that exists within the device due to the movement of charge carriers.
3. Current density - This is a property of the device, as it refers to the amount of current flowing through a given area of the device.
4. Saturation current density (J sat) - This is a specific value of the current density that occurs when the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V, and it is a property of the device.

Therefore, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Reverse voltage
2. Internal electric field
3. Current density
4. Saturation current density (J sat)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to material properties in the paragraph:

1. Reverse voltage - This is a material property as it refers to the voltage applied across the device in the opposite direction to the conventional flow of current.
2. Internal electric field - This is a material property as it refers to the electric field that exists within the device due to the movement of charge carriers.
3. Saturation current density (J sat) - This is a material property as it refers to the maximum current density that occurs when the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V.

Therefore, the entities that clearly refer to material properties in the paragraph are:

1. Reverse voltage
2. Internal electric field
3. Saturation current density (J sat)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Reverse voltage |
| Internal electric field |
| Saturation current density (J sat) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. Reverse voltage (V) - a measure of the voltage applied across a device in the opposite direction of its normal operation.
2. 2 V - a specific value of reverse voltage that is used as a threshold for suppressing recombination.
3. J sat - an abbreviation for "saturation current density", which is the maximum current density that can occur in a device due to recombination.

These entities represent properties or values that are relevant to the operation of the device being discussed in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. Reverse voltage (V) - a measure of the voltage applied across a device in the opposite direction of its normal operation.
2. 2 V - a specific value of reverse voltage that is used as a threshold for suppressing recombination.

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Reverse voltage (V) |
| 2 V |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
